detaileddescription.para: Engine where this selection is attached to.
kill a single unit in the selection
checks whether there are any builders in the selection
checks whether there are any military units (i.e. non-builders) in the selection

memberdef.argsstring: (const Player &player, Terrain *terrain, coord::camgame p, bool append=false)
memberdef.name: select_point

memberdef.argsstring: (const Player &player, Terrain *terrain, coord::camgame p1, coord::camgame p2, bool append=false)
memberdef.name: select_space

detaileddescription.para: uses command on every selected unit
Must be given a valid unit to display text attribute indicators.

Check whether the currently selected units may be selected at the same time If not, deselect some units This is the order in which the checks occur: Own units > own building(s) > enemy unit > enemy building > any object
So you can select a group of units, or a building (or multiple if append is on) Enemy units, enemy buildings and other objects may only be selected one at a time
a user interface component allowing control of a selected group
